column4: Hey. If I connect through a router, I can get to the Net. If I connect to a cable modem, using DHCP, I can get a proper IP address, but can not resolve DNS. Also, if I try pinging by IP address, I get an error message: connect: network is unreachable. How can I fix this?
I have no firestarter installed.
iptables are empty, and my ipmasq is off.
Plus it all works on the same, dhcp protocol, but with a router.
I power cycled everything.
is the computer connected straight to the cable modem or do you have something inbetween?
your nameservers are wrong.
that is when I am connected to the router, so it looks fine here...
log into your router and see which nameservers are in use in there and put those in your resolv.conf
sure, I will try that. The thing is that I can not ping out at all. Not even to IP addresses with the modem. That means no DNS resolving will fix it, but I am willingh to try. I will be back.
when connected to the router, you will use the nameservers the router has got from the modem. if you are not using the router, you will not be able to connect to 192.168.0.1
that is clear.
(of course, it could be that the cable-modem has that address but it is more likely that the modem has got your public ip address registered instead)
are your router set up to give a static ip for the computer?
or, if you are using firestarter, have you enabled dhcp there (also write in the nameservers in the DNS tab)
it is normal that you get a new ip address each time you connect with the modem. nothing strange in that
not on cable
I work tech support for this.
well, it is not up to you or your router or your modem. it's your ISP that give you the public ip address. if you get different ones, it is them doing it.
agreed
your nameservers should not change very often though. it is usually safe to put them into firestarter or resolv.conf instead of 192.168.0.1
